column1:
share on x ds dale swan. jun 20 at 10:10 pm i am extremely grateful for having my aunt anne in my life. she was a great example of unconditional love and was always a great example to how we should live our lives. i will miss her dearly and all the talks we used to have, i can hear her now talking with such pure joy about her grand kids and great grand's . i loved listening to her when she talked about them, because i knew this brought her joy! thank you patrick, megan , shawn, and cole and carter for being such an important part of her life and bringing her much joy. aunt ann i love you ! and will miss you . your niece dale. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x cc cathi cryan. jun 20 at 4:05 pm to kevin and our children, i'm so sorry for what you are going through. i too, share your loss, your love, and memories of a very wonderful mother and grandmother. she loved each of us so much! now all we have are so many wonderful memories of her. she was a very strong and loving person! now we can only imagine where she is in heaven, celebrating her reunion now, showing off many of her talented skills, cooking up her sauce, pastas, stromboli, ravioli, and all her wonderful baked goods. crocheting, knitting, and sewing. she is in the arms of the love of her life, papa john and with her son, your uncle dennis. i love each of you dearly and i am here for you! i was so blessed to be her daughter-in-law and the "only daughter she never had"! comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x ks katherine stoiber. jun 20 at 1:02 pm to kevin, cathi, patrick, megan and sean: youvhave my sincere sympathy on the loss of your wonderful mother and grandmother. ann was such a good and caring person and will be missed by all those who knew her and loved her. i know she is happy to be with her lord now, as well as with john and dennis. you were his good and faithful servant, ann, so i know you are now resting in his peace. with love and sympathy, aunt katie1 comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x more memories... visitation. jun 24. 3:00 pm - 7:00 pm coyle funeral and cremation services1770 s. reynolds road. toledo, oh, us, 43614. get order flowers now for antoinette's visitation no medias to show. 365 days of grief support. subscribe facebook linkedin coyle funeral and cremation services website designed by funeralone contact obituaries about store 
get order flowers now for antoinette's visitation show less view & service share facebook twitter google+ post now light a candle virtual gifts yellow rose periwinkle blue green red dove angel heart hug butterfly roses hands in prayer bible sunshine teddy american flag veteran rosary gardener interlocked rings catholic cross football baseball golf sailboat firefighter non catholic cross basketball police buddha hockey coach soccer star of david canadian flag menorah memories events media share a memory of antoinette "ann" cryan send comfort to the cryan family when it's needed most. to show you care same-day hand delivery by a local florist! bc brenda cody. jun 21 at 4:26 pm kevin, cathy, patrick, meg, and sean..... our sincere condolences to your family during this time. may your loving memories soon replace the sadness. may warmth replace the pain. may your broken hearts heal, to be replaced with laughter and light at the memory of your beloved anne..... your mother, grandmother, beloved friend. frank and brenda cody. comment share comment share facebook twitter
